website_summaries.verdict: For only a slight price increase over its single-core cousins, the Asus Eee PC 1015PEM's dual-core Atom CPU handles multitasking better, but this Netbook doesn't offer the features or performance we've seen in higher-priced "premium" alternatives.
pros: dual-core Atom processor offers better multitasking speeds
cost for a dual-core Atom configuration isn't much more than for the single-core alternative
cons: streaming full-screen videos don't look much better than on single-core Atom Netbooks
lacks HD screen and HD accelerated graphics

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of well thought out reviews here so I am going to keep this short and sweet. After lugging around a 100lb laptop from work (well, it seems that heavy after a while) this little beauty is a welcome addition to my arsenal of electronics. I like this so much I am going to request my work laptop be replaced with a similar size computer. This thing is perfect for traveling; I have already used it as a GPS using Microsoft Streets (with GPS antenna) and tethered my phone to it for internet on the go. I have had this a week now and my wife is dropping subtle hints that she may also want one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Glass

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a simple 'net book to take on the road with me. It is literally 1/2 the size and weight of my Dell laptop and has a superb screen. I get 8-10 hours of battery life, it boots up fast, and just generally works well for its intended purpose. I would NOT want this as my sole computer or sole laptop due to the small size and limited capabilities, but for checking e-mail, surfing, and light typing on the road... it's great. The touch pad is my sole complaint, but I'm getting used to it and I carry a Logitech mini-mouse for extended sessions. I've had mine for 2 months as of this writing.
customer_reviews.author: NMHighPlains

customer_reviews.title: Very slow computer that has difficulties getting onto wifi
customer_reviews.text: I own two other ASUS computers and they work really well. This netbook computer was so slow that it took forever to download anything. It also kept dropping out of my wifi here at my home for some unexplained reason. I got it for travel as it has a 13 hour battery. I have one of the orignal 7 inch Eee PC's from ASUS and it's not on Microsoft software and works brilliantly except for a too small screen and keyboard. It's possible the Microsoft 7 software installed on this netbook may be slowing the computer down. It's also possible I may have gotten a lemon. My 15 inch ASUS laptop works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Bazza

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Great little netbook
customer_reviews.text: I received my ASUS 2 days after ordering. It was well packaged, easy to setup and run. It's fast, has great resolution, terrific batter life, functional keyboard and good construction all around - and for $368 is a great alternative to a laptop - if your primary usage is Internet, email and media. I'll leave all my data on my old Dell, but will probably use the ASUS more around the house (watching a movie while keeping up on March Madness) and while traveling. I would definitely recommend it for anyone interested in a netbook but not quite sold on the "I" family of ever-obsolecing Apple products or other tablets.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Allen

customer_reviews.title: 4 to 5 hour battery life...Windows 7 Premium would be nice
customer_reviews.text: Can't really complain. The truth is that I love this netbook, and I'd be surprised if there is a better one out there for the price. I knew I wasn't actually gonna get 13 hours of battery life: I got 4 to 5 while charging my cell phone, doing some file transfers, watching videos and slideshows, and web browsing--pretty good, I think. What I didn't know was how limiting Windows 7 Starter is. I highly suggest that if you don't have experience with Starter, do some research to help you decide whether you are going to need to factor in the cost of upgrading to Home Premium or something.
customer_reviews.author: IslandDad

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it - but get the extra memory!
customer_reviews.text: For a netbook, this thing is really pretty excellent. It's not as fast as my i7 laptop but then again, nobody expects it to be. I've installed a LOT of stuff on this little machine and it's handled it easily. But definitely get the 2G memory for it. The 1G out of the box just isn't enough. A couple of days ago I inadvertently dropped the netbook in the airport. It fell to a hard floor from about 2 feet but there was no damage at all. That was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin King

customer_reviews.title: Broke up before a year! :badluck:
customer_reviews.text: My first review was outstanding because de netbook worked perfectly and i loved it, but before even a year the computer stop working! first, the battery didnt charge anymore, and all of a sudden the windows stop working! i tried to reinstall windows but the problem persist and it seems that the hard drive didnt work anymore :/ I think that i was the one with bad luck, and i also think that is a good machine, but mine was bad. The worst of all is that i dont live in USA, so there is nothing i can do with the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Barrientos

customer_reviews.title: ASUS eee PC 1015PEM-PU17
customer_reviews.text: This machine has made me a convert to netbooks. My 17 inch laptop is still useful for looking at more than one document at the same time but the ability to actually put a machine in my lap or to carry it effortlessly from home to work or travel has made me use it much more frequently than the 17 incher or even the 14 incher I had before. I found the upgrade to 2 gig ram effortless. Just make sure you upgrade the bios by visiting the ASUS update site before you install the new 2gig ram chip. The ASUS update link is preloaded on the computer so it is easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I am a tiny bit disappointed that ASUS stated that these have the 3.0 USB and they do not. Still I think this is the most practical, best running, and best priced netbooks available right now. I wasn't expecting the 3.0 USB when I bought it because of the various blogs around the web have stated that there is not one yet to be found. Nonetheless, I am so far happy with my purchase, especially after upgrading the RAM to 2G. P.S. make sure you buy the 1333 MHz if you are going to upgrade the RAM, it is required, and Patriot sells a decent one for $14 on Amazon. [...]
customer_reviews.author: bfrank336

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for money
customer_reviews.text: This netbook is for my wife. She loves the fact that it is so small. As I find out from her that she wants one, I chose this one because: - it has global warranty (1 year) - it has a battery which lasts pretty much (specifications: up to 13 hours, from experience 9-10 hours) - it has all the needed accessories: Bluetooth, big enough hdd (250GB) - the color (blue) looks perfect on this small thing - the RAM can be extended to 2GB (which I did - bought Crucial CT25664BC1067 2GB 204-PIN PC3-8500, and works great)
customer_reviews.author: Razvan

customer_reviews.title: Great portable machine
customer_reviews.text: I removed the Windows starter and installed Ubuntu (Linux distribution) to run this machine and it's working great. Starts up quickly, runs fast enough, is great for web surfing, e-mail, watching online video. The keyboard is reasonably easy to use despite its small size. The only thing I dislike is the buttons below the touch pad. Instead of separate right and left click buttons, there is a single bar that rocks about the center. That forces me to to press on the bar pretty far the left to get a left click which is not as easy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Yarusso

customer_reviews.title: worked fine for the year and a half I needed it ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this for nursing school, worked fine for the year and a half I needed it but soon just got so slow and started to crash a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Great Netbook
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item based on reviews posted by other purchasers, it's features (matched for our needs) and of course - price. I could not find it locally - so I went with Amazon. Could not be happier. Very quick shipping - great price. As far as the ASUS Eee PC 1015PEM-PU17-BU 10.1-Inch Netbook -- 5 stars. It does what we need and then some. It's quick, large HD - will probably upgrade RAM to 2 GB. Good graphics and great battery life. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dire-wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great NetPC - No Problem with Windows Starter
customer_reviews.text: I received the netbook a few days ago. With Windows 7 Starter installed, I was able to install all my software - and they work. I installed Windows Essentials 2011 Live Mail, and it works perfectly. With the processor, and Windows 7 Starter the programs load quickly. Seems to be a well built machine. I immediately installed the 2GB memory care, the one recommended by Amazon and it installed with no problems. Would highlyrecommend the purchase of this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Eee 1015 10.1 inch netbook
customer_reviews.text: Good performance, battery life, weight and value. Keypad is somewhat fragile, though. Not suitable for very intense use, but for occasional travels (emails checking, ebook reading, file your pictures or presentations...). Writing this comment after 6 months of use: battery no longer works, despite my care in using computer without charger and keeping battery charged after reaching 1/4 of total charge, as always done with previous netbooks. A new battery costs around US$80.00
customer_reviews.author: F. Andreis

customer_reviews.title: Great netbook !!!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Asus 1005AH with this new model and found it to be the best one I used. It is faster due to N550 proccessor and it has better LCD. I did upgrade to the memory to 2 GB and windows 7 home primume to get all the benefits you can dream from netbook. The matt screen is an adventage so you can see movies with no reflections from objects in your area. I recommand this product and give 5 stars since you get the best value for money.
customer_reviews.author: J. NIR

customer_reviews.title: review after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a travel computer as I did not want to carry my 15" for a three month trip. Upgraded the RAM to 2GB and ran the computer on Google Chrome-which is just perfect for the smaller screen. The cursor/touchpad was way to sensitive and I adjusted its sensitivity. The screen is bright, the keypad fine, it is quick and lightweight and has long battery life. Truly a nice machine which is easy to use. I have been back for a few weeks now and I reach for this computer rather than the 15" which costs three times as much!
customer_reviews.author: gumbyen

customer_reviews.title: Best notebook so far
customer_reviews.text: I really understand about market share, and I really believe that this ASUS is "eating the candies" of other old and well-known brands. I highly recommend this little and powerful one, upgrading RAM memory to 2GB. If you're thinking about buying a netbook, please at least check on the web (users opinions) about this one before deciding. I'm sure you'll decide for this.
customer_reviews.author: David Guerrero Santos

customer_reviews.title: love it! so far it works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I had a Asus eeepc 1015 and now I bought this one. so far Asus has not let me down. I dont know computer a lot, I just use it to take note in class and surf this internet. but so far it works good. the only compliant I have is the Win 7 Starter. it would be nice if it comes with Win 7 home edition at least.
customer_reviews.author: F. Chan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a laptop, but it's hard to remember:) It is small, but you know that before ordering. It is perfect for the function for which it was purchased.......kind of like a mini traveling office. I can get online, do work in Word, office, excel, take notes on it.....even load movies and music. The online web storage is a huge plus, though I've yet to need it.
customer_reviews.author: Hap Eee :)

customer_reviews.title: Great Netbook if in working condition.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the white one to have a little style thrown in. Pros: easy to use keyboard multi touch touch pad durable Dual core adds a good kick just good looking in general. Cons: Ships with only 1gb or RAM Battery burnt out for me in 3 months Was working fine, then one day without warning just shut down. Battery won't hold a charge, and I've already emailed ASUS about the issue. Will post updates. After 2 replacements from asus and the 2nd one dying, I decided to go aftermarket. The computer is great, battery SUCKS.
customer_reviews.author: David Canas

customer_reviews.title: Withstood the test of time
customer_reviews.text: Lasted me for around almost 3 years. I gave it an intense beating(Not Physically). I ran tons of programs that were intense for the this little cpu. It is a good piece of equipment. Maybe if I used it as a normal person I would have gotten more life out of it. Once thing I loved about it was that it is so compact and so easy to take everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Flybysaint

customer_reviews.title: Great Netbook!
customer_reviews.text: Great little computer. Pros - long battery life - very portable - charges quickly - able to handle my everyday use (web browsing, video watching, programming, document editing) - received very quickly after ordering :) Cons - none that i can think of at the moment
customer_reviews.author: William Greer

customer_reviews.title: For daughter
customer_reviews.text: it worked well until she knocked off of a coffee table, now it needs a new monitor. She plugs it into a monitor. but she dropped it again and destroyed it completely. I am assuming it worked because she didn't bitch about it. Gee, can you sense I'm a bit bitter over this one? We don't discuss it any longer, very bad subject.
customer_reviews.author: sonia

customer_reviews.title: Update to the jumpy cursor problem
customer_reviews.text: I wrote the first review in December 2010 when I had the problem with the cursor jumping around when I type some text. I gave it a rating of 2 stars. I came back to the United States from my travel abroad in May 2011 and contacted ASUS customer support. They told me to download the latest touchpad driver and I did that. The problem appears to have been solved since I seldom experienced this problem with the latest driver. I will monitor this problem to see if the problem is really solved but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: JKM

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my computer today and everything seems to be working fine so far. Of course, I do realize that most problems with products often occur later on. I haven't had any problems with the mouse pad but this may be because I'm used to a not so great mouse pad on my Dell laptop (that I hate btw.) I've only removed one bloatware program so far and this little computer seems to be running just fine and youtube videos have appeared fairly smooth. Hopefully this netbook continues to perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad netbook... should have bought a tablet
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a specific purpose: to connect to our stereo system to stream itunes and internet radio through several pairs of in-ceiling speakers in our home. It works great for this purpose. As a general laptop, the keyboard is a bit small and I would prefer the 12 in. screen of the larger netbooks, but this is a nice computer. There wasn't that much crapware attached either. Very slow to load- anything!
customer_reviews.author: RVadict

customer_reviews.title: Nice with some VERY ANNOYING hiccups
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is GREAT. The battery life is impressive. BUT, the MOST annoying hiccup on this netbook is that the cursor will jump while you are busy typing. I'll be taking notes during class and all of a sudden out of nowhere there will be a selection of text and if you are not careful it will automatically delete if you are typing. OR the cursor will jump to a line above and you will be typing in a different place. That is NOT what you need when you are sitting in law school trying desperately to take down every word said.
customer_reviews.author: Nats

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Netbook with Epic Battery Life!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little netbook for my wife for Christmas. She loves it. I purchased the 2gb ram memory chip at the same time and it was a quick and easy install. The super long battery life allows her to use the machine all day without having to plug it in. And the size makes it convenient and portable.
customer_reviews.author: TapQ

customer_reviews.title: Good product, outstanding battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this netbook as I need to travel back and forth between US and Europe and was looking for something light to stay connected while I travel. I upgraded the Ram to 2GB. It takes a few days to get used to the keyboard and the touchpad, but afterwards I hardly noticed the difference from my full-sized laptop. On the other hand, this netbook is light, fits almost everywhere, has a decent screen, it is fast enough for web-browsing/email/skype/word-processing etc.. and the battery just seems to last forever. Now sure if you get up to the 13.5 hours advertised, but I am definitely able to get more than 10 hours of work between charges.
customer_reviews.author: ri_ny

customer_reviews.title: Solid machine
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife who needed more portability than her laptop provided. It does what we wanted a netbook to do- 1)wireless works well; 2)keyboard is easy to use, not too small; 3)battery life is good- got at least 10 hours, didn't run it down; 4)easy to carry around- took it on a trip overseas, very comfortable. I have not added the additional ram yet, but will get the latest firmware and upgrade soon. A good buy for the money.....
customer_reviews.author: VAL

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: Simply awesome. Pros: Fast in pretty much every aspect, including surfing the web, online video streaming, boot-up/shutdown, games, operating multiple documents, movies...etc Very quiet, long battery-life, highly portable. Cons: I have not found anything bad about this netbook so far besides the annoying default asus netbook commercial screesaver that I can't find any way to delete. It's the perfect netbook if you use it for class and a bit of gaming. These are the only two reasons that I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: KOTW

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what the doctor ordered
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for work and net surfing during overseas trips and so far - so good. I upgraded the memory, as someone suggested here, and it was a great move. It has the ability to do basic word processing and net surfing, but this computer is obviously not made for heavy gaming or programs that need a speedy processor. For those that travel and need something for the same reasons I do, then this computer is for you.
customer_reviews.author: D. Krupski

customer_reviews.title: Asus 1015 PEM
customer_reviews.text: Received this little baby today.So far so good. Everything is working great.from Only complaint is I cant seem to transfer docs M/Office. But I am sure that I can work around that. Ordered 2g memory but even with 1g it works very smooth and spped not bad. Key board is easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: samg

customer_reviews.title: Eee 1015PEM
customer_reviews.text: Great netbook and the easiest to upgrade the memory of any which I have dealt with. Less than 2 minutes! I prefer the keys on my Eee 1005 though. The only real negative (which is minor) was that it did not come with the travel sleeve as stated. The non-shiny screen is so much better than my 1005. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Goldfish

customer_reviews.title: Small, Lightweight, and Fast
customer_reviews.text: First netbook I've ever owned, but I really like it. The only thing that has given me trouble was the RAM upgrade I bought for it. I installed it the RAM, and it wouldn't turn on. So after coming to the conclusion that I needed to update the BIOS, I tried using the Asus EZFlash utility that came installed on the motherboard, but for some reason it won't read the file from my USB stick. I've read over the directions again and again to make sure I wasn't missing something, but everything is where it should be. Now I have a 2GB stick of laptop RAM sitting around for nothing. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Goroski

customer_reviews.title: Asus 1015PEM
customer_reviews.text: With the added 2gig of ddram it is a dream machine. The battery lasts easily ten+ hours and it hasn't displayed any glitches/failures. The transformer on the power cord does get warm but not enough to pose a safety hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still going good.
customer_reviews.text: Bought several years ago, and still going great. It is now a bit sluggish. I am planning to upgrade HDD with SSD.
customer_reviews.author: RSvazoo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 2gb ram (HIGHLY recommended!) Everything worked great out of the box. ASUS downloads and updates were a piece of cake! Bought the Win 7 home premium - glad I did. Probably should've come out of the box with it - the starter is just that - a teaser. Battery life is amazing! HIGHLY recommend this netbook to anyone who's looking for a small, powerful PC.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Comstock

customer_reviews.title: Great camera privacy slide
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Great camera privacy slide. Wifi on/off switch works. Rugged, durable case.
customer_reviews.author: gubb man

customer_reviews.title: Using it right now to do this review
customer_reviews.text: This is my first netbook and it is great. I have a dual boot Win7 and Ubuntu. Battery life is great and when hooked up to an external monitor it is a definite desktop substitute for what I do. It is quirky: Can't do dual monitors (two separate desktops) 1024x600 resolution is a little odd...not standard for many websites Limited to 2 gigs of memory Keyboard takes a little getting used to. A little underpowered for graphics. I would easily do it again, but might spring for a little higher model. Overall, very happy
customer_reviews.author: P. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great netbook!
customer_reviews.text: For a netbook, it's very zippy. I'm not a huge fan of the see-saw-style mouse buttons (would rather have separate buttons), but it's not a deal breaker. I upgraded the RAM to 2 GB and put Windows 7 Pro on there to get the most out of the hardware. FYI - you'll have to flash the BIOS to the latest version to get it to accept the 2 GB stick of RAM. This is very simple with a flash drive and ALT+F2 at POST.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Sawyers

customer_reviews.title: 5 years later and I still love this laptop
customer_reviews.text: 3.5 years later and I still love this laptop. It's gone to Africa with me. I've had to change the battery and charger out, but that costs less than $10 on ebay. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: UncreativeName

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: great notebook, i gifted this to my dad and he loved it. I bought the white one and it looks great. but only default pics can be used for desktop background, that's weird, i dont know if all notebooks are like this.
customer_reviews.author: satish nanda

customer_reviews.title: Great for Traveling
customer_reviews.text: Great traveling computer. It can be a bit slow at times and I wish the RAM could be extended beyond 2G but it works well. I use it when I travel to give seminars.
customer_reviews.author: LipidGuy

customer_reviews.title: Battery life excells
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Asus for battery life...running MS Office products 8 hours a day without plugging in prematurely kills the battery in my otherwise great Dell laptop. The Asus works all day with several hours battery reserve at the end of the day. Great. Only problem I had was adjusting to the 92% scale keyboard...really takes concentration to hit the correct key (arrow up instead of right shift key) and slows data entry substantially but the fact that I can work "more slowly" all day is worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: sg4184

customer_reviews.title: I love my computer
customer_reviews.text: Its tiny, very light weight and easy to take everywhere with me. It stays charged for a long time and is a great on the go computer. The only thing I would change is the addition of being able to use the mouse pad to expand or contract the web page as in previous models. This makes it easier to view on the small screen. I love my netbook.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you add RAM
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this Asus Eee PC 1015PEM, it was running Windows 7 with 1GB RAM. Things ran slower than I had hoped. I swapped in a 2GB RAM module,, and now things seem to be running quicker. No other complaints: battery life is great, screen looks good, very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I loved this little netbook, very portable and that is what i was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Luis Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: net/notebook
customer_reviews.text: Although I am still getting used to this small computer it has met all my expectations with few disappointments. The keyboard has a very positive feel, the wireless connection seems flawless, and the portable battery gives my more than enough time to complete every task. Using the "Super Hybrid Engine" setting and "Balance power" button I get at least 8 hours of battery time. Programs work great. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: David Keans

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is my first netbook and I am very impressed with the performance and quality of the 1015PEM- PU17. The keyboard and display are excellent. From reading reviews here I was thinking I would need to add more RAM and was expecting the computer to run slow. It is pretty fast. I researched netbooks for over a month and this seemed like the best deal going. Compared to other netbooks it is very stylish and looks very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: B. Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for our college aged son. He had picked it out and sent the amazon.com link to me. It was slightly more expensive than an acer I had seen but it came with a longer life battery and was within my budget, so this was the one I ordered. I had never heard of the brand name, but a young man I work with had ordered one for himself. My son loves it and says it ranks right up top of his all time favorite gifts.
customer_reviews.author: pmy0451

customer_reviews.title: Needed the memory upgrade, battery stopped working after the warranty ran out
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded the memory to get this netbook to run slightly faster. While, it runs okay for the most part, it's still a bit slow. I also had issues with the battery and had to buy a replacement since the warranty ran out right after the battery stopped holding a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Jmitsu

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for traveling, so I could easily surf and send emails on the road. It's light and works fine for intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Otter of the Universe

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Great so Far
customer_reviews.text: Just got this a few days ago, and so far I'm very happy. I installed Ubuntu 10.10 netbook respin (which is awesome btw), and upgraded to 2gigs ram (with the patriot brand stick). Everything works really well, with a few exceptions: -the power cord is poorly designed and often becomes disconnected with a slight movement of the computer -the mouse clicker is a little stiff, and loud especially compared to the smooth apple clickers
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: More like a laptop than a notebook.
customer_reviews.text: The battery usually lasts a couple of days under normal use. It is slightly heaver than a typical netbook, but the performance is more notebook like. When you readycache with the USB 3.0 you get even better speeds on typical tasks. This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Mindchapter

customer_reviews.title: Charger stopped working after 30 days....
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, the screen resolution is just ok. Battery does last a long time (10+ hours) but our charger just stopped working about 30 days after my daughter started using the PC.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: I've had this little baby for 2 weeks and it's great. I got 7-8hrs of battery life with wifi on, nearly 13hrs with it off. I removed all of the pre-installed applications and added my own stuff and it performs great. It's nearly as fast as my laptop. Streams video and netflix movies great. Even a little light gaming. I would recommend this netbook to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Just plain underpowered.
customer_reviews.text: It's weak. I have a tablet I got for $120 (Nook HD) that is faster than it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter. She liked it from the very beginning. Great battery time and just the right weight. The dual core processor makes it a very powerful little pal for Youtube video but don't expect to watch full HD, even 720p is not too good. About the keyboard, just right for her hands but not for mine. In all, this was a great gift taken from her words.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Mata

customer_reviews.title: Was  a gift, but I have recieved no complaints!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my girlfriend and she loves it! Has had no problems with it and says that it runs well and is easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: netbook by Asus
customer_reviews.text: It is a sleek nice product. Perfect for my son who is at home attending community college right now. He really likes it, and for what he needs it is perfect fit, he doesn't need anything fancy. Easy to load software and get it going and set up for our home router/network. Battery has good life for it's size. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: paperg320

customer_reviews.title: Great netbook for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this laptop just for over a week. Until now no complaints. Just that the keyboard is a little weird. It is not really sensible, but doesn't bother me really. Just have to get used to it. Battery lasts long. Until now it hasn't lasted the 13 hours they say, but i've been able to use it for 8 hours, but not really tested it a lot. Is fast, but im going to buy the 2gb RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Chew

customer_reviews.title: Great netbook
customer_reviews.text: I baught this netbook for my son It performs very good, fast internet navigation. I upgraded te memory to 2gigs and it's even faster. Battery runs for about 10 hours less than the 13 hours announced, but it's a good battery life for him.
customer_reviews.author: James Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: Set up easy, works great. I'm impressed with this powerful little computer. Replaced HP 1000 series with screwed up video card. Was sold on HP & Dell but big name don't mean much anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery P. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little slow but for the price and size it's not bad
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio

customer_reviews.title: great little netbook
customer_reviews.text: needed a PC with a dual-core processor to run some proprietary software & the ASUS1015PEM was an excellent choice; expanded RAM to 2GB to run my apps; would recommend this to anyone considering the purchase of this netbook.
customer_reviews.author: danp

customer_reviews.title: Asus Netbook
customer_reviews.text: This netbook is awesome! Simply the best I have ever owned! would highly recomend! Finds and connects to available wireless connections super fast! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: joilstoils

customer_reviews.title: powerful battery bad screen
customer_reviews.text: I got this stuff only 2 days after my order. I was so excited to open the package and found it so cute, but upset to see that the screen showed not clear as I expect, even worse than my old laptop! I think about returning it, but the battery act perfect and the keyboard is so nice, I love it! So it's OK!
customer_reviews.author: ning

customer_reviews.title: Asus Eee PC 1015PEM
customer_reviews.text: This little item works as advertised. With Win7 on it all drivers and battery life are as they say, Install Linux (Ubuntu or otherwise) and performance drops - it is highly dependant on its windows drivers to meet advertised performance marks. Do not bother with 1gig - max it out to 2gig from the start.
customer_reviews.author: James Beam

customer_reviews.title: Great netbook!
customer_reviews.text: I love this netbook. It does everything I need. I installed a 2GB chip of RAM and am pretty happy with everything!
customer_reviews.author: Warner Lai

customer_reviews.title: Asus Netbook
customer_reviews.text: This little net book is great for internet surfing and email,this is what I use it for.Very light,moble,and fast.Happy with this netbook so far..Just wish it came with 2g instead of the 1g
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, great speed !
customer_reviews.text: It is a great, light weight and very portable PC. It comes with features where the desk top PC has. It's dual core speed is fabulous at its price! There is USB3 as well. Webcam quality needs improvement. ASUS should load this little machine with 2GB of RAMS rather than entry level 1GB !
customer_reviews.author: Master

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to the netbook world so I was extremely hesitant before purchasing one. Looking back now I can't imagine why. This little gizmo is amazing and exactly what I needed- highly portable, long battery life and reasonably priced for my graduate school needs. Everyone should absolutely buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: excellent battery life!
customer_reviews.text: this little thing looks great, very light to carry around, and gives me 10+ hours of battery life! I'm very pleased with ASUS EeePC 1015PEM, now I take it with me to school and it'll hold me more than 1 day's lecture!
customer_reviews.author: KYFan

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: The product is exactly as advertised. The size is great for traveling. The processor is fast...alas... I am an Apple fan and this is just something I had to have for work; but that it does, and nicely.
customer_reviews.author: J.P-H.

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Eee PC 1015PEM-PU17-WT 10.1-Inch Netbook (White)
customer_reviews.text: It was a very good small netbook to start my freshmen year in college. Good products gets a little bit slow as time passes i have it for about 3 years now. Affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Valdivia

customer_reviews.title: Great Product. Can get pricey with add ons
customer_reviews.text: This was the first netbook that I have bought and I have to say that is met all of my expectations. I am using it for school purposes (microsoft office, internet, etc.) and have had no problems. Highly recommend going with 2GB memory upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: buckman

customer_reviews.title: Portable, easy to use, not as fast as a full-sized...
customer_reviews.text: I love how compact it is, light, super portable. While it's not as fast as a full sized computer/laptop it works great. I have big hands and have a little trouble with the keyboard but am getting used to it. Definitely recommend it for the traveler!
customer_reviews.author: joselynrider

customer_reviews.title: Fast but Touch Pad WAY too Sensitive
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I decided to purchase this netbook. While this netbook IS fast, there are two things that made me return this computer. 1) The touch pad is WAY too sensitive. I changed all the settings to low sensitivity and anytime I would BARELY touch the touch pad, the pointer would jump to another point on the computer. It became ridiculous and extremely irritating. 2) The keyboard is extremely cramped. I've used netbooks before and this one is particularly small. I had to return this computer because I just couldn't handle the mouse jumping around anymore.
customer_reviews.author: wingman25

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great little computer. I use it for work everyday. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Eee pc-1015PEM PU17
customer_reviews.text: Bought this nice little computer intended for my travel but ended up being used by my daughter (2nd yr chem eng MSc student) who actually likes it very much and find it good enough for her school use.
customer_reviews.author: ARamCOwnk

customer_reviews.title: Broke on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for my daughter. Could not get it to power on after several attempts. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Latoya Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Asus Eep Pc
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT! Have had no problems and I carry it everywhere. IT IS SO LIGHT. I would highly recommended this product to anyone who needs a computer on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not enough memory
customer_reviews.text: Although the notebook is fantastic, has a great screen and a excellent battery life (+12 hours), I find it slow due to not enough internal memory. Therefore I will order the expansion soon
customer_reviews.author: Belgiank

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this net book for my mom for Christmas. She had it for a week and a couple of thee keys from the keyboard fell off. It was also very slow straight out of the package. DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Jake skahill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little thing
customer_reviews.text: After upgrading it to 2 GB RAM seems that it can handle most of my computing needs beyond Web surfing, email and office stuff. The keyboard is very comfortable and the sound is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Ocanto

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Eee PC 1015PEM
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be more satisfied. The Eee PC is just the right size and weight. Battery life is awesome. Boot up time is lightning quick. I upgraded to 2G of RAM from the get go, so it's plenty quick too.
customer_reviews.author: bitsnkiblz

customer_reviews.title: great net book
customer_reviews.text: great net book, awesome battery life and with the memory upgrade smoking fast, wish they would just inclucde the 2gig memory instead of making you jump through that hoop.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: We just recently purchased the Eee PC. It has worked well. It has more functionality than a normal net book, more like a regular laptop.
customer_reviews.author: DJN

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this netbook for a little over 2 weeks now and love it. I upgraded the memory to 2 gigs and am using Win7 starter that came with it. The trackpad and keyboard are great. I can get about 9 hours of battery life if I turn the brightness down and turn off the wifi. This is the first netbook I have owned, so I don't really know how it compares to others, but I do not notice any lagging and all of my programs load up very quickly. This is the perfect travel computer!
customer_reviews.author: Spudrucket

customer_reviews.title: Good netbook
customer_reviews.text: my first netbook, definitely takes a bit to get used to compared to laptop (mainly keyboard and screen). handy as a second/ travel computer to surf internet, check email, skype, etc. works as expected. small screen takes getting used to as not all websites shrink to fit. recommend upgrade to 2GB RAM. Most other netbooks I looked at seemed pretty similar but gave this one a shot based on other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Best Netbook Ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this netbook last week and so far, I am totally in love. It is small, light and seems pretty fast for a netbook. I am getting another gig of RAM to help give it a little boost. I don't regret getting this netbook, it is amazing. Good job ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Hickman

customer_reviews.title: Amazon made my day
customer_reviews.text: The first one received was defective right out of box: kept crashing and got very hot. Amazon sent me a replacement with expedited shipping at my request without charge, just in time for a business trip. The first Asus netbook got 0 star and the second got 4 so average is 2 stars. The third star is for Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Slan

customer_reviews.title: Work Fit
customer_reviews.text: Essential, upgrade to Microsoft Windows 7 full. The Starter 7 leaves to much out. Plus, needs an upgrade to 2 gig RAM for faster responses. Now, this netbook exceeds my road needs. Really like the keyboard. Also, the Bluetooth works well with my Google phone.
customer_reviews.author: Levelone

customer_reviews.title: terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Every product can have a lemon - it's what the company does with the lemon that matters. This product has been defective from the start. No amount of customer service has been able to resolve the multiple issues, which have taken many hours of our time with no resolution. We've had it for just about a month, and will now look to return it. You can be absolutely certain we will not buy this brand ever again.
customer_reviews.author: willimar

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent netbook with very good performance. No real need to expand the memory to 3GB. Not as fragile as many other netbooks.
customer_reviews.author: hbj

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is awesome. I speculated getting a netbook for a long time and after putting ubuntu 10.10 on it , it runs great. Tried to play "crush the castle" and the graphics can't keep up but looks like the 1015pn has the ion2. For $368 its great but if you want some better graphics get the pn. The battery is great and the computer is solid. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: For my needs - perfect.
customer_reviews.text: For my needs - perfect. Power saving options. Light weight. Small machine, wide-set keyboard. Thank you... may I have another?
customer_reviews.author: nathan atkinson

customer_reviews.title: bloatware - noisy hard drive - slow on win7
customer_reviews.text: unimpressed: - loads of crapware, - harddrive has clicking sound (will it fail on me soon ?), - switched to 2GB of RAM - Windows still rather slow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ASUS Eee PC 1015PEM-PU17-BK 10.1-Inch Netbook (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackEmbrace mobile computing in style with the new Asus Eee PC 1015PEM. The 1015PEM packs the latest ATOM CPU from Intel, the Dual Core N550, which consumes less power than its predecessors, allowing the 1015PEM to get up to a whopping 13 hours of battery life. With built-in Wi-Fi 802.11b/g/n, users can stay connected wherever they go. The 92%-scaled ergonomic keyboard and Multi-Touch touchpad make it a breeze to type and navigate through content. The 1015PEM's 250GB hard drive and 500GB of free webstorage provide a wealth of storage and backup capabilities. The 1015PEM also features a chiclet keyboard for added style and comfort.

AMAZON.COM

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars256 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
